string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one2
string-array.item: accent : (n) distinctive manner of oral expression. "\n"ascent : (n) A movement upward. "\n"assent : (v) agreement with a statement or proposal to do something.
accept : (v) means to receive willingly."\n"except : (prep) means apart from or excluding.
advice : (n) Opinion about what could or should be done about a situation or problem."\n"advise : (v)To offer advice to, to give information/advice.
adverse : (adj) contrary to one\"s interests or welfare. "\n"averse: (adj) strongly opposed (usually followed by (to))
aid : (v) to give help or assistance, be of service, assistance."\n"aide : (n) an assistant.
altogether : (adv) to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent "\n"all together : (adv) in each other\"s company.
altar : (n) a table or flat surface where religious rituals take place. "\n"alter : (v) cause to change; make different; cause a transformation.
amend : (v) make changes to, to improve or make better "\n"emend : (v) to make corrections to (not always for the better) (rarely used).
artist : (n) a person whose creative work shows sensitivity and imagination "\n"artiste : (n) a public performer (a dancer or singer).

astrology : (n) the study of the movements and positions of the sun, moon, planets and stars, and the skill of describing the expected effect that some people believe these have on the character and behaviour of humans. "\n"astronomy : (n) the scientific study of the universe and of objects which exist naturally in space, such as the moon, the sun, planets and stars.
a while : a length of time."\n"awhile : (adv) for a short time.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_two2
string-array.item: ball : (n) round object that is hit, thrown or kicked in games. "\n"bawl : (v) shout loudly and without restraint, to cry.
bloc : (n) a group of countries in special alliance. "\n"block : (n) a solid piece of something (usually having flat rectangular sides).
blue : (n) of the color intermediate between green and violet; having a color similar to that of a clear unclouded sky. "\n"blew : (v) Exhaled hard.
board : (n) a committee having supervisory powers or a flat piece of wood. "\n"bored : (v) a feeling of lack of interes.
bold : (adj) someone who is fearless and courageous. "\n"bald : (adj) it is used to describe someone (usually a man) with no hair on their head.
borne : (v) carried or transported by. "\n"born : (v) brought into existence.
breath : (n) air that is taken in and expelled during breathing. "\n"breathe : (v) draw air into, and expel out of, the lungs.
breech : (n) opening in the rear of the barrel of a gun where bullets can be loaded. "\n"breach : (n) act in disregard of laws, rules, contracts, or promises.
bridle : (n) headgear for a horse; includes a headstall and bit and reins to give the rider or driver control. "\n"bridal : (n) a marriage ceremony; a wedding.
bring : (v) carry or transport something or somebody with oneself to another place. "\n"take : (v) carry out something or someone from one place to another or to do.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_two3
string-array.item: can : (v) able to. "\n"ken : (n) range of what one can know or understand (rarely used).
capital : (n) a town or city that is the official seat of government in a political entity. "\n"capitol : (n) it is used to describe a building in which a US state government meets.
censor : () someone who censures or condemns. "\n"censure : () harsh criticism or disapproval.

certain : (adj) it is used when something is impossible to avoid or extremely likely to happen. "\n"curtain : (n) it is used to describe a piece of material that hangs across a window or opening to make a room or part of a room dark or private.
cleanup : (n) a very large profit. "\n"clean up : (v) put (things or places) in order.
click : (n) a short light metallic sound, a brief, sharp, nonresonant sound. "\n"clique : (n) an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose, a small, exclusive group of friends or associates.

collage : (n) an artistic composition of materials and objects pasted over a surface, often with unifying lines and color. The art of creating such compositions. "\n"college : (n) educational institution.
compare : (n) to consider or describe as similar, equal, or analogous, liken. "\n"compere : (n) the master of ceremonies, as of a television entertainment program or a variety show.
complement : (n) it means to make something seem better or more attractive when combined. "\n"compliment : (n) it means a remark that expresses approval, admiration or respect.

confuse : (v) to cause to be unable to think with clarity or act with intelligence or understanding. "\n"confess : (v) it is used when someone admits or states that they have committed a crime or are at fault in some way.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_two4
string-array.item: decent : (adj) it means socially acceptable or good."\n"descent : (n) it means a movement downwards, or your ancestry.
decision : (n) to describe a conclusion or resolution reached after consideration."\n"division : (n) It can describe the action of separating something into parts, or the process of being separated.
defrost : (v) to remove ice or frost from."\n"melt : (v) it means to turn from something solid into something soft or liquid.
desperate : (adj) it mean extreme or very bad."\n"disparate : (adj) it means different in every way.

destroy : (v) means to put an end to the existence of something by damaging or attacking it, or to completely ruin or spoil something. "\n"destruct : (v) but we do not use it much in British English. You might see it with a prefix, such as self-destruct or auto-destruct.

discreet : () it means to be careful or modest, not to cause embarrassment or attract too much attention, especially by keeping something secret. "\n"discrete : (adj) it means something is distinct and separate or has a clear independent shape or form.

dose : (n) means a measured amount of something, especially medicine. As a verb it means to give someone a measured amount of medicine. "\n"doze : (v) means to have a short sleep, especially during the day and "a doze" is a short sleep.
downside : (n) the lower side or portion."\n"underside : (n) the side or surface that is underneath; the bottom side.
dress up : () It can mean to put on a costume, or to put on your best clothes. "\n"get dressed : It means to put on clothes.

driving test : (also known as a driving exam) is a procedure designed to test a person\'s ability to drive a motor vehicle. "\n"test drive : when you drive an automobile to assess it, usually before buying it.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_two5
string-array.item: e.g. : stands for exempli gratia = for example."\n"i.e. : stands for id est = that is (in explanation).
effect : (n) a result, to have an impact on something or someone."\n"affect : (v) to have an influence on or effect a change in
enquiry : (v) a search for knowledge ( a variant of \'inquiry\' UK mostly)"\n"inquiry : (v) an examination of facts.
ethic : (n) the principles of right and wrong that are accepted by an individual or a social group. "\n"ethics : (n) motivation based on ideas of right and wrong
every day : it means each day without exception."\n"everyday : it means ordinary days or routine occasions.
except : (prep) with the exclusion of, other than."\n"expect : (v) which we use when we think something is likely to happen, or someone is likely to do or be something in particular.
execute : (v) to put into effect. "\n"executive : (n) a person or group having administrative or managerial authority in an organization.
expand : (v) to increase the size, volume, quantity, or scope of; enlarge."\n" "\n"expend : (v) it means to use or spend something (especially time, effort or money).

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_two6
string-array.item: faint : (adj) deficient in magnitude; barely perceptible; lacking clarity or brightness or loudness etc; or to lose consciousness. "\n"feint : (n) deceive by a mock action.
fair : (adj) free from favoritism or self-interest or bias or deception; conforming with established standards or rules. "\n"fare : (v) the sum charged for riding in a public conveyance.
fallible : (adj) likely to fail or make errors."\n"fallacious : (adj) containing or based on a fallacy or untruth.
farther : (adv) expression of physical distance."\n"further : (adj) an expression of figurative, metaphorical distance.
faze : (v) disturb the composure of."\n"phase : (n) any distinct time period in a sequence of events.
feet : (n) the part of the leg of a human being below the ankle joint."\n"feat : (n) a notable achievement.
finally : (adj) after an unspecified period of time or an especially long delay. "\n"finely : (adv) in tiny pieces.
fined : (n) issued a ticket or a fine as a penalty."\n"find : (v) come upon, as if by accident; meet with.
flair : (n) a natural talent."\n"flare : (v) a shape that spreads outward or a sudden burst of light or a device for producing a bright flame.
flew : (v) travel through the air; be airborne (past of fly)."\n"flu : (n) an acute febrile highly contagious viral disease.
for : it is used to indicates a period of time."\n"since : it is used to indicates a point in time.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two7
string-array.item: getaway : (n) a location for respite, an escape"\n"get away : (v) to escape.
good : (adj) being positive or desirable in nature."\n"well : (adj) in a good or proper manner.
gray : (n) US spelling"\n"grey : (n) UK spelling"\n"The colour between black and white can be written gray or grey.
grisly : () it means horrible."\n"grizzly : () it is a bear from North America.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two8
string-array.item: hard : (adj) it means solid, industrious, or difficult. "\n"hardly : (adv) it means only just or certainly not.

hear : (v) it means to receive or become aware of a sound using your ears."\n"listen : () it means to give attention to someone or something in order to hear them, so you make an effort in order to hear something properly.

heroin : (n) it is a powerful illegal drug, obtained from morphine and is extremely addictive."\n"heroine : (n) is a female person who is admired for having done something very brave or having achieved something great. The male equivalent is hero.
he\'s : it is the short form of \"he is\" or \"he has\"."\n"his : (pron) it is used to show something belonging to or connected with a man, boy or male animal that has just been mentioned.

holiday : (n) A day on which custom or the law dictates a halting of general business activity to commemorate or celebrate a particular event."\n"\\the weekend : (n) the end of the week, especially the period from Friday evening through Sunday evening.

holy : (adj) belonging to, derived from, or associated with a divine power, sacred."\n"holly : (n) a widely distributed evergreen shrub, typically having prickly dark green leaves, small white flowers, and red berries.
homework : (n) work, such as schoolwork or piecework, that is done at home."\n"housework : (n) The tasks, such as cleaning and cooking, that are performed in housekeeping.

hope : (v) to wish for something with expectation of its fulfillment."\n"wish : (v) it means you want something to happen, or to be true, a desire, longing, or strong inclination for a specific thing.
human : (adj) characteristic of humanity"\n"humane : (adj) pertaining to or concerned with the humanities or the quality of having compassion.
hurdle : (n) an obstacle that is in the way."\n"hurtle : (v) move with or as if with a rushing sound.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two9
string-array.item: I : (pron) the subjective case of me"\n"me : (pron) the objective case of I
illicit : (adj) contrary to accepted morality (especially sexual morality) or convention. "\n"elicit : (v) call forth (emotions, feelings, and responses).
immunity : (n) the quality or condition of being immune."\n"impunity : (n) exemption from punishment, penalty, or harm.
improve : (v) it means to get better."\n"improvise : (v) it means to invent or make something without having planned it.
incite : (v) give an incentive for action"\n"insight : (n) clear or deep perception of a situation
incredible : (adj) beyond belief or understanding."\n"incredulous : (adj) not disposed or willing to believe; unbelieving.
indiscreet : (adj) lacking discretion, injudicious. "\n"indiscrete : (adj) not divided or divisible into parts.
ingenious : (adj) showing inventiveness and skill."\n"ingenuous : (adj) characterized by an inability to mask your feelings; not devious.
interesting : (adj) it means it gets your attention because it may be unusual, exciting, or has a lot of ideas. "\n"curious : (adj) eager to learn more.
intrusive : (adj) tending to intrude (especially upon privacy)."\n"obtrusive : (adj) undesirably noticeable

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two11
string-array.item: kerb : () non-american spelling of curb."\n"curb : (n) a concrete border or row of joined stones forming part of a gutter along the edge of a street.
kin : (n) related by blood."\n"ken : (n) range of what one can know or understand.

knight : (n) originally a person of noble birth trained to arms and chivalry; today in Great Britain a person honored by the sovereign for personal merit. "\n"night : (n) the time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside.
know : (v) aware of a fact or a specific piece of information; possess knowledge or information about. "\n"now : (adv) it is used to describe the present time or moment.

knows : (v) be cognizant or aware of a fact or a specific piece of information; possess knowledge or information about."\n"nose : (n) the organ of smell and entrance to the respiratory tract; the prominent part of the face of man or other mammals.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two_child11
string-array.item: look forward(s) vs look forward to

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two12
string-array.item: later : (adv) It is used to express time, either in the future or after the time you have mentioned. "\n"latter : (adj) it means near or towards the end of something.
lay : It means to put something or someone down (often in a horizontal postion). "\n"lie : It means to rest in a horizontal position1 or to be located somewhere.
lend : (v) bestow a quality on or give something to someone with the expectation of getting it back (often money). "\n"loan : (n) a temporary provision of money (usually at interest) or an object .
lessen : (v) decrease in size, extent, or range."\n"lesson : (n) a unit of instruction or something learned by experience.
live : (v) if someone lives somewhere they are a permanent resident of that place. "\n"stay : (v) but in this context if you stay somewhere it is temporary.
look after : means to take care of or be in charge of something or someone. "\n"look for : means to try to find something or someone.

look at : (v) something or someone you are interested in the appearance of that thing or person. Generally we look at things that are static. "\n"watch : (v) to look or observe attentively or carefully, be closely observant.
look forward(s) : (v) it means you are looking ahead."\n" look forward to : (phrasal verb) it is used when you feel happy and excited about something that is going to happen.
look over : (phrasal verb) quickly examine someone or something."\n"overlook : (v) it means fail to notice or consider it or them.

loose : (adj) If something isn\'t fixed properly or it doesn\'t fit, because it\'s too large, it\'s loose."\n"lose : (v) it means to no longer possess something because you do not know where it is, or because it has been taken away from you.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two13
string-array.item: manor : (n) the mansion of a lord or wealthy person, a landed estate."\n"manner : (n) a way of doing something or the way in which a thing is done or happens.
mantel : (n) shelf that projects from wall above fireplace "\n"mantle : (n) the cloak as a symbol of authority

massage : (v, n) to rub and press someone\'s body with regular repeated movements, in order to relax them or to reduce stiffness or pain in their joints. As a noun it is the activity of rubbing or pressing parts of someone\'s body in order to make them relax or to stop their muscles hurting. "\n"message : () it is a short piece of information that you give to a person when you cannot speak to them directly.
marshal : (n) a federal law officer that carries out the judgments of a court of law; organize by rank and position. "\n"martial : (adj) befitting a warrior (of persons).
me : (obj) to refer to yourself. "\n"my : (possessive adjective) to refer that something or someone belong to yourself.
mite : (n) a slight but appreciable amount or a tiny microscopic insect.. "\n"might : (n) expresses possibility.
moan : (v) means to make a complaint in an unhappy voice. "\n"mourn : (v) feel or express great sadness, especially because of someone\'s death.

moral : (n, adj) as a noun or an adjective, which is used to describe standards of good or bad character and behaviour. It can also be used to describe a kind of story that tells you how you should or should not behave. "\n"morale : (n) is a noun that describes the amount of confidence felt by a person or group of people, especially when in a dangerous or difficult situation.
most : almost all or the largest part."\n"mostly : it means generally, mainly, chiefly, usually.
mute : (adj) expressed without speech. "\n"moot : (n) of no legal significance (as having been previously decided).

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two14
string-array.item: nauseated : (n) feeling nausea; feeling about to vomit. "\n"nauseous : (adj) the state of having nausea or causing nausea.
noisome : (adj) having a very bad or offensive smell. "\n"noisy : (adj) full of or characterized by loud and nonmusical sounds.
nun : (n) a religious woman or a woman member of a religious order, often bound by poverty, chastity, and obedience. "\n"none : (pron) not at all or in no way.
nutritional : (adj) of or relating to or providing nutrition. "\n"nutritious : (adj) of or providing nourishment.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two_child14
string-array.item: overtake vs takeover vs take over

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two15
string-array.item: obsolescent : (adj) becoming obsolete. "\n"obsolete : (adj) no longer in use.
official : (adj) a worker who holds or is invested with an office. "\n"officious : (adj) intrusive in a meddling or offensive manner.
of course : informal way of saying \'yes\' or to give someone permission to do something. "\n"off course : used when a vehicle doesn\'t follow a planned, or intended, route.
of : (prep) used to show possession or the relationship between two things. "\n"off : (adv) to show when something is away from a certain place or time, or as a preposition of movement.
ordinance : (n) an authoritative command or order "\n"ordnance : (n) military materiel, such as weapons, ammunition, combat vehicles, and equipment.
ought : (v) expresses an emotional, practical, or other reason for doing something. "\n"aught : (pron) anything whatever.
overrun : (v) to seize the positions of and defeat conclusively. "\n"run over : (phrasal verb) to collide with, knock down, and even physically go over someone or something.

overtake : (v) It can mean to go beyond something by being better, or if you\'re driving to come from behind another vehicle or a person and move in front of it. "\n"takeover : (n) it is used when one organisation gains control of a company by buying most of its shares. "\n"take over : (phrasal verb) it means to get control of a company by buying most of its shares.
overdo : (v) do something to an excessive degree. "\n"overdue : (adj) past due; not paid at the scheduled time.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two16
string-array.item: pair : (n a set of two similar things considered as a unit.br /> "\n"pare : (v decrease gradually or bit by bit. "\n"pear : (n sweet juicy gritty-textured fruit available in many varieties.
palate : (n) the upper surface of the mouth that separates the oral and nasal cavities.br /> "\n"palette : (n) the range of color characteristic of a particular artist or painting or school of art.
pass away : (phrasal verb) is a phrasal verb. It is used when someone dies. "\n"pass out : (phrasal verb) it is used when someone loses consciousness for a short time.
peak : (n) the most extreme possible amount or value.br /> "\n"peek : (v) a secret look.
personal : (adj) of or relating to a particular person. "\n"personnel : (n) the body of persons employed by or active in an organization, business, or service.
pore : (v) any tiny hole admitting passage of a liquid (fluid or gas).br /> "\n"pour : (v) cause to run.
practice : (n) used as noun "\n"practise : (v) used as verb "\n"both have meaning - to do or perform habitually or customarily, make a habit of.
precede : (v) to come, exist, or occur before in time. "\n"proceed : (v) to go forward or onward, especially after an interruption, continue.
principal : (adj)it means first in order of importance. "\n"principle : (n) a basic truth, law, or assumption, standard of behaviour or rule that explains or controls how something happens or works.
probably : (adv) most likely. it used to express a level of certainty that\'s slightly less than 100%. "\n"properly : (adv) it is used to show something has been done in the right way.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two17
string-array.item: quiet : (adj) making no noise, silent. "\n"quite : (adv) to the greatest extent, completely.
quell : (v) suppress or crush completely. "\n"quench : (v) satisfy (thirst).
quiet : (adj) characterized by an absence or near absence of agitation, sound or activity. "\n"quit : (v) put an end to a state or an activity.
quotation : (n) a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage. "\n"quote : (v) repeat a passage from.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two18
string-array.item: raise : (v) to move to a higher position; elevate. something else is needed to raise something "\n"rise : (v) something rises by itself.
rain : (n) water falling in drops from vapor condensed in the atmosphere. "\n"reign : (n) have sovereign power.
recourse : (n) act of turning to for assistance. "\n"resource : (n) available source of wealth; a new or reserve supply that can be drawn upon when needed.

regard : (v) usually means to have an opinion about something or someone. "\n"regardless : (adv) in spite of everything, anyway, not being affected by something. "\n"regards : it is simply a greeting.

remainder : (n) something left over after other parts have been taken away. "\n"reminder : it can be anything that causes you to remember something, it can also be a message or note, or any communciation designed to ensure that you remember something.

remember : (v) to recall to the mind; think of again. to be able to bring back a piece of information into your mind, or to keep a piece of information in your memory. "\n"remind : (v) to cause to remember, put in mind. to make someone aware of something they have forgotten or might have forgotten.
replay : (v) to play over again. "\n"reply : (v) to give an answer in speech or writing.
restive : (adj) being in a tense state. "\n"restless : (adj) lacking rest or worried and uneasy or in constant motion.
respectfully : (adj) in a respectful manner. "\n"respectively : (adv) in the order given.
review : (v) look at again; examine again "\n"revue : (n) a variety show with topical sketches and songs and dancing and comedians.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two19
string-array.item: say : (v) to pronounce words or sounds, to express a thought, opinion, or suggestion, or to state a fact or instruction. "\n"talk : (v) means to actually say words out loud; to speak to someone. "\n"tell : (v) to give a detailed account of, narrate.
scared : (adj) it is used to describe a person or maybe an animal that is frightened or worried. "\n"scary : (adj) it is used to describe something or someone that causes fear or terror.
shortage : (n) a deficiency in amount; an insufficiency. "\n"shortness : (n) the condition of being short spatially.

so : when used as in front of an adjective or an adverb means very. "\n"such : when used as a determiner can be used in front of a noun or an adjective and a noun to show extremes, you can\'t use it in front of adverbs.
some time : means a period of time "\n"sometime(s) : indicates a time in the future or the past which is not known or not stated.
some : (adj) it is used for an unspecified number or quantity and for positive statements. "\n"any : (adj) for questions and negative statements.
sooth : (adj) it means real - true - Soft - smooth. "\n"soothe : (v) to calm or placate, To ease or relieve from pain.
stationary : (adj) not moving. not capable of being moved; fixed. "\n"stationery : (n) is the collective noun for Writing materials and office supplies such as paper, pens, pencils and envelopes.
stick : (n) it usually describes a thin piece of wood that has fallen or been cut from a tree. "\n"sticker : (n) it is used to describe an adhesive label or notice, generally printed or illustrated.

strange : (adj) it is used to describe something as unusual or surprising in a way that is unsettling or hard to understand. "\n"stranger : (n) it is used to describe a person whom one does not know or with whom one is not familiar.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two_child19
string-array.item: take care vs take care of
travel vs trip vs voyage vs journey

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two20
string-array.item: take care : is used when saying goodbye to someone. It actually means "Take care of yourself." "\n"take care of : means to look after someone or something.
team : (n) a cooperative unit (especially in sports). "\n"teem : (v) be teeming, be abuzz .
than : (conj) used to introduce the second element or clause of an unequal comparison. "\n"then : (adv) at that time.

that : (pron) it is a pronoun, and is used as the subject or object of a verb to show which person or thing you are referring to, or to add information about a person or thing just mentioned. It can be used for people and things. It can sometimes be omitted. "\n"which : (pron) it is a pronoun, and is used as the subject or object of a verb to show what thing or things you are referring to, or to add information about the thing just mentioned. It is used for things, not people. "\n"who : (pron) it is a pronoun, and is used as the subject or object of a verb to show which person you are referring to, or to add information about a person just mentioned. It is used for people, not things.
there : (adv) at or in that place. "\n"their : (adj) the possessive form of they. "\n"they\'re : it is contracted form of \"they are\".
tide : (n) the periodic rise and fall of the sea level under the gravitational pull of the moon or a trend. "\n"tied : (adj) bound or secured closely.
to : (prep) in a direction toward so as to reach. "\n"too : (adv) in addition. "\n"two : (n) it is a number - 2.
trainer : (n) one who trains. "\n"trainee : (n) one who is being trained.

travel : (v) used in general terms - to go from one place to another. "
"trip : (n) is often substituted for the word holiday when the travelling distance was short. "
"voyage : (n) a long journey, as: A journey by sea to a foreign or distant land. "
"journey : (n) the act of traveling from one place to another. It means the 'piece' of travel between 2 or more points.
troop : (n) a group of people or animals (usually soldiers ) or go somewhere in a group. "\n"troupe : (n) organization of performers and associated personnel (especially theatrical).

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two_child20
string-array.item: used to vs used to do

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two21
string-array.item: upmost : (adj) means at the highest or most upward position. "\n"utmost : (adj) it means of the greatest degree or most extreme.

us : (pron) it is also a pronoun, but it is used as the object of a verb or a preposition to mean the person communicating and at least one other person. "\n"we : (pron) it is a pronoun used as the subject of a verb,to mean the person communicating and at least one other person.

used to : (adj) made familiar with, accustomed to. "\n"used to do : (structure) it is used to talk an activity that we did regularly in the past (like a habit), and it is also used for a situation that was true in the past.
urn : (n) a large vase that usually has a pedestal or feet. "\n"earn : (v) earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages.
urban : (adj) relating to or concerned with a city or densely populated area. "\n"urbane : (adj) showing a high degree of refinement and the assurance that comes from wide social experience.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two22
string-array.item: vain : (adj) characteristic of false pride; having an exaggerated sense of self-importance. "\n"vane : (n) mechanical device attached to an elevated structure; rotates freely to show the direction of the wind. "\n"vein : (n) a blood vessel Or a narrow channel in rock that carries water or gold.
vale : (n) a long depression in the surface of the land that usually contains a river. "\n"veil : (n) to obscure, or conceal with or as if with a veil.
vary : (v) become different in some particular way, without permanently losing one\'s or its former characteristics or essence. "\n"very : (adv) used as an intensifier.
venal : (adj) capable of being corrupted. "\n"venial : (adj) warranting only temporal punishment.
veracious : (adj) habitually speaking the truth. "\n"voracious : (adj) excessively greedy and grasping.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two23
string-array.item: wade : (v) walk through relatively shallow water. "\n"weighed : (v) determine the weight of.
waist : (n) the narrowing of the body between the ribs and hips. "\n"waste : (v) spend thoughtlessly; throw away.

waive : (v) do without or cease to hold or adhere to. "\n"wave : (v) one of a series of ridges that moves across the surface of a liquid (especially across a large body of water) or numerous increments of an object or objects.
wander : (v) to move about without a definite destination or purpose. "\n"wonder : (v) astonishment, surprise or admiration.
warn : (v) to make aware in advance of actual or potential harm, danger, or evil. "\n"worn : (adj) affected by wear or use.

watch : (v) means to deliberately look at something for a period of time, especially something that is changing or moving. it is used with progressive forms. "\n"see : (v) is noticing something or somebody with your eyes, usually with no explicit intention or purpose behind the action. See is not used with progressive forms.

what : (w.h. q) it is used to ask a question when there are an unknown number or infinite possibilities for an answer. "\n"which : (w.h. q) it is used when you are choosing between two items/ a more limited number of items.

who : (pron) it is used, when you are referring to the subject of a clause. "\n"which : (pron) it is used as the subject or object of a verb to show what thing or things you are referring to. "\n"that : (pron) it is used as the subject or object of a verb to show which person or thing you are referring to.

who : (pron) what or which person or persons. it is used, when you are referring to the subject of a clause. "\n"whom : (pron) The objective case of who. it is used, when you are referring to the object of a clause.

which : (pron) interrogative pronoun, used both substantively and adjectivally, and in direct and indirect questions, to ask for, or refer to, an individual person or thing among several of a class. "\n"witch : (n) a female sorcerer or magician.

string-array.name: items_array_expandable_level_one_two24
string-array.item: you\'re : is short for you are. "\n"your : it shows that something belongs to \"you\" or is related to \"you\".
